dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan b Shadab Khan 42 (35b 3x4 2x6 51m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: charges and will keep charging all the way to the pavilion! Possibly influenced by the silly point fielder in an effort to smash the ball and get him to go back to the circle, Asghar stampedes down the pitch to hammer a beautifully flighted ball on fifth stump. It holds it's line instead of turning and he's beaten trying to club this back over Shadab's head as the ball clips off stump. A promising stand ends.

headshotImage.longCaption: Shaheen Shah Afridi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran b Shaheen Shah Afridi 42 (54b 6x4 0x6 75m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: Najibullah's party comes to an end dragging on! Shaheen pitched this up and went tighter to the stumps compared to the previous ball at 137 kph. Najibullah wanted to clear extra cover but no footwork really and drags a thick inside edge onto off stump. Shaheen with three scalps for the second match in a row.

headshotImage.caption: Shaheen Shah Afridi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaheen Shah Afridi player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Gulbadin Naib headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Gulbadin Naib headshot

dismissalComment.html: big nick! Or is it?! Given not out with Gulbadin driving well away from his body. Sarfaraz calls for the review! Seemed completely obvious live that he edged that ball but Nigel Llong didn't think so. Sarfaraz took an eternity to review overthinking things, i.e., was it so obvious that it wasn't an edge after all? Of course it was! Ultra-edge shows a clear spike when ball passes bat. Umpire Llong changes his signal.

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he's on a hat-trick! What a whirlwind over! Not the best ball to be fair. Full and angling down leg, should have been ticked through fine leg for four but Hashmatullah is out in front of the ball and his attempt to play it through the leg side results in a leading edge that balloons over Shaheen towards mid-off. Imad jogs 10 yards left and takes it at waist height in stride.

headshotImage.caption: Najibullah Zadran headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Najibullah Zadran headshot

dismissalComment.html: Najibullah's party comes to an end dragging on! Shaheen pitched this up and went tighter to the stumps compared to the previous ball at 137 kph. Najibullah wanted to clear extra cover but no footwork really and drags a thick inside edge onto off stump. Shaheen with three scalps for the second match in a row.

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the slower ball is unplayable today from Shaheen! This time Rashid is the one left looking like a schoolboy by Shaheen, producing an offcutter landing on a full length on off stump. Rashid can't keep his hands back long enough and aborts his drive resulting in a skier over mid-off. Simple catch take at chest height on the ring. Shaheen the dream!

headshotImage.caption: Wahab Riaz headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Wahab Riaz headshot

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nabi headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

dismissalComment.html: caught at fine leg - what you done Nabi! Suckered into the pull shot, short ball on leg stump, he couldn't control himself and went for it. Amir was at fine leg, and he comes forward and take a good low catch.

headshotImage.caption: Hamid Hassan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Hamid Hassan headshot

dismissalComment.html: yorker bingo! Not too many No. 10s will be able to keep that out. Picture perfect pinging the base of off stump at 140 kph/87 mph as Hamid plays inside the line trying to stab this out.

dismissalText.long: c Babar Azam b Imad Wasim
dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c Babar Azam b Imad Wasim 35 (43b 5x4 0x6 54m) SR: 81.39

dismissalComment.html: leading edge goes to short cover. This was also bowled at 96kph, but Imad got it to grip and hold on the pitch. Also got it to turn gently. Rahmat thought there's a straightforward single for the taking to midwicket, but found that he had brought his bat down too early, and the leading edge pops up for a simple catch

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Hafeez b Imad Wasim
dismissalText.commentary: Ikram Alikhil c Mohammad Hafeez b Imad Wasim 24 (66b 1x4 0x6 90m) SR: 36.36

dismissalComment.html: the dot ball pressure on Ikram finally bursts! Floaty delivery at 84 kph/52 mph on about 7th/8th stump, just inside the wide guidelines, Ikram had to reach out a long way trying to slog this over long-on. Got more of the toe of the bat on it than middle and the ball loops in the air toward long-on. Simple catch taken at rib height 10 yards in from the rope.

dismissalText.commentary: Babar Azam b Mohammad Nabi 45 (51b 5x4 0x6 63m) SR: 88.23

dismissalComment.html: bowled around his legs! The President strikes! Nabi floats this full on leg stump at 82 kph/51 mph. Babar thought it was safe to sweep on the line expecting it to spin down leg but it's A: too full for the sweep; and B: doesn't turn! Goes straight on after pitching and clips leg stump!

headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

headshotImage.caption: Imam-ul-Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imam-ul-Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: charged and stumped! What was Imam thinking? Charges seemingly out of nowhere in impetuous fashion. Nabi darted this in quicker at 91 kph/57 mph, and much wider too. Imam essentially yorks himself on the dance down the pitch playing over the top with a wild drive. Ikram was pulled away from the stumps on the width but still had enough time to shuffle across and dislodge the bails.

headshotImage.caption: Fakhar Azam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fakhar Azam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: strikes second ball!. Given lbw but the batsman goes up to review. That looked out on first sight. Pitched on a length and spun in, carrom ball, beat his defensive prod to strike him on the pad. Bat and pad are very close to together, and there is a spike. I think it's of ball hitting pad, there's a gap between ball and bat. The third umpire's thinking the same. And ball tracking shows three reds! So not only have Pakistan lost Fakhar, they've lost a review too.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Hafeez headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Hafeez headshot

dismissalComment.html: straight to point! soft, soft dismissal for Hafeez. A bit on the shorter side, carrom ball I think, and he just slices it tamely into point's waiting hands. He's distraught, Afghanistan are back to smiling

dismissalText.commentary: Haris Sohail lbw b Rashid Khan 27 (57b 2x4 0x6 58m) SR: 47.36

dismissalComment.html: Rashid's wicket drought is over! Beaten going onto the back foot and given leg before! Good length ball, touch more air, goes back to defend and misses, struck on the knee roll well inside the crease. Only real question for Paul Wilson was did this pitch in line with leg stump. He says yes. Haris is on his way!

dismissalText.commentary: Sarfaraz Ahmed run out (Najibullah Zadran/†Ikram Alikhil) 18 (22b 1x4 0x6 37m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: runout! Pakistan are throwing this away! Googly lands way too short and wide on around 7th stump. Sarfaraz cut this behind point for a simple one, the point sweeper Najibullah is the quickest fielder of the XI for Afghanistan and the last guy Sarfaraz should be taking on. He circles around like a Blue Tiger to pounce, fire a sharp relay to Ikram with Sarfaraz five yards short. Never a second run there. Imad wasn't really interested and Sarfaraz only has himself to blame.

dismissalText.commentary: Shadab Khan run out (Gulbadin Naib/†Ikram Alikhil) 11 (17b 1x4 0x6 33m) SR: 64.7

dismissalComment.html: run out at the striker's end. Length ball, whipped against the turn to deep midwicket and for some reason, Shadab thinks there's two there and hares back. But replays confirm the throw is good and the bails are off before he could get back. The match is alive again!

commentTextItems.html: Imad has done it! another full toss outside off, and he keeps icy calm to thread this through cover, bisects the field and sends this to the boundary. Pakistan are roaring and alive in the World Cup 2019. What a win!

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.15pm: Okay, that was a nail-biter and a half. We've rubbed the edges of our seats raw, and we'll take a quick lie-down. For Pakistan, 'IT' is very much still on. Their World Cup is alive and roaring still. Meanwhile, the World Cup today is also very much alive, with New Zealand having just lost a wicket against Australia. Hop on over to that match here. But from Peter Della Penna, Thilak and myself, it's goodbye from this game.

Sarfaraz: "Thanks to the crowd, they cheered us all the way. It is a great win for us. Not an easy pitch to bat on, but credit goes to Imad - the way he batted, the way he handled pressure, hats off to him. We knew it was not an easy chase, their bowlers used the conditions very well. Babar and Imam played very well, we needed a partnership in the middle that didn't happen, but we got it in the end. A full team effort. We all knew it's not an easy task in the World Cup, but we took it match by match. Shaheen Afridi is improving day by day, he's working very hard. The other bowlers also bowled really well. All are in good nick. (On India vs England) Obviously we'll all watch, hopefully the better team will win."

Gulbadin: "We fought very well and gave 100% but in the end we missed an opportunity to win the match. But credit goes to Pakistan. Imad played really well and Shadab gave him the strike well. We're playing these kind of teams, so you'll face these situations. But if you win the match... as you saw we lost at the end of the innings. Bad luck for us today, Hamid Hasan was injured. The wicket was slow and turning, credit to Nabi, Mujeeb, Rashid and Sami also. But we missed Hamid. I said at the start of the tournament 30-40 is not enough, you need 60-70 or 100, then you can put a good total. But each batsman, including me, should go one step forward. We are learning a lot, so hopefully we'll do well in the future. Thank you to the tremendous crowd here."

6.02pm: The emotions of this match have spilled over. Monga reports from the ground that there is rioting in the stands: "They are still rioting. Bottles are flying across. 650ml juice and soft drinks bottles. They are full, and they are being hurled at each other." Good god!
Ram: "be ready for ind vs pak and aus vs nz semifinals!!"

6pm: The umpiring should also be a topic of discussion. It hurt Afghanistan immeasurably today. But they need to learn how to use their reviews. Meanwhile Pakistan are now in 4th place on the points table, a point ahead of England.

Imad Wasim is the Man of the Match. "When I went in, Rashid Khan was bowling brilliantly. I couldn't pick him to be honest. But we knew that if we play 50 overs, we'll win. Gulbadin was the only bowler to be targetted, the wicket was turning square. If you take risks against them you can lose your wicket. Thank you very much to the crowd, it feels like home here. This is for the crowd. If we win the next game, you never know what happens. This win gives us confidence as well."
And Monga pings from the ground: "Scenes! pitch invasion. Nabi accidentally tackled by a security officer. More people entering the ground. More than 10 now".

5.56pm: Afghanistan will be hurting after this, while Pakistan will be jubilant. They've pulled off another great escape. Gulbadin will have a lot to answer for. His decision to bowl will need some explaining when the spinners were doing so well, Shinwari had overs left, and had given up just 2 in his last over. For now though, it's all a big sea of green at the stadium and joy for Pakistan.

commentTextItems.html: very full outside off, driven fluently to cover, who relays a straight throw to Naib who fumbles it with the batsman hout of his crease. Not only that he lets it slip, and they steal a second. Gulbadin's every nightmare coming alive.
strays down leg, Wahab doesn't connect with the big heave, so it rolls off his pad to short fine leg

commentPreTextItems.html: 6 needed off 6. Within one hit for Wahab. But Imad on strike, and that's what Pakistan will want. Gulbadin is back for the last over. Last attempt at redemption?

commentTextItems.html: another full toss outside off, flayed through the offside but he has protection in the deep. Terrible bowling by Gulbadin
googly on the pads, rolls to short fine leg off the pads but they take a single. Imad will be on strike for the final over

commentTextItems.html: reverse sweep! What pressure? Wahab just pulls out that shot and sends it to deep cover. Ungainly in the end but effective
another googly, another heave that aimed at sending the ball to London. Misses it. The ball goes dangerously close to off stump
quicker googly, also shorter, chopped down to long-off. There is some scrambling in the field by Afghanistan and that means they can hare back for the second
Wahab Riaz is Pakistan's hero. What a nerveless strike. Googly in the slot, he goes down on one knee and smashes it way over deep midwicket. What a hit.

commentPreTextItems.html: 16 off 12, with Wahab on strike. Mujeeb is hobbling off, that hit to the ankle really hurt.

commentTextItems.html: goes for the wild heave but misses completely. Leg break on off and turning away
fuller outside off, carved to point. Ends a fabulous spell from Mujeeb

good length, dips again, hit to the bowler of the toe end

dismissalComment.html: big nick! Or is it?! Given not out with Gulbadin driving well away from his body. Sarfaraz calls for the review! Seemed completely obvious live that he edged that ball but Nigel Llong didn't think so. Sarfaraz took an eternity to review overthinking things, i.e., was it so obvious that it wasn't an edge after all? Of course it was! Ultra-edge shows a clear spike when ball passes bat. Umpire Llong changes his signal.

dismissalComment.html: the dot ball pressure on Ikram finally bursts! Floaty delivery at 84 kph/52 mph on about 7th/8th stump, just inside the wide guidelines, Ikram had to reach out a long way trying to slog this over long-on. Got more of the toe of the bat on it than middle and the ball loops in the air toward long-on. Simple catch taken at rib height 10 yards in from the rope.

dismissalComment.html: charges and will keep charging all the way to the pavilion! Possibly influenced by the silly point fielder in an effort to smash the ball and get him to go back to the circle, Asghar stampedes down the pitch to hammer a beautifully flighted ball on fifth stump. It holds it's line instead of turning and he's beaten trying to club this back over Shadab's head as the ball clips off stump. A promising stand ends.

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan b Shadab Khan 42 (35b 3x4 2x6 51m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: charges and will keep charging all the way to the pavilion! Possibly influenced by the silly point fielder in an effort to smash the ball and get him to go back to the circle, Asghar stampedes down the pitch to hammer a beautifully flighted ball on fifth stump. It holds it's line instead of turning and he's beaten trying to club this back over Shadab's head as the ball clips off stump. A promising stand ends.

dismissalComment.html: the dot ball pressure on Ikram finally bursts! Floaty delivery at 84 kph/52 mph on about 7th/8th stump, just inside the wide guidelines, Ikram had to reach out a long way trying to slog this over long-on. Got more of the toe of the bat on it than middle and the ball loops in the air toward long-on. Simple catch taken at rib height 10 yards in from the rope.

dismissalComment.html: Najibullah's party comes to an end dragging on! Shaheen pitched this up and went tighter to the stumps compared to the previous ball at 137 kph. dismissalComment.html: the slower ball is unplayable today from Shaheen! This time Rashid is the one left looking like a schoolboy by Shaheen, producing an offcutter landing on a full length on off stump. Rashid can't keep his hands back long enough and aborts his drive resulting in a skier over mid-off. Simple catch take at chest height on the ring. Shaheen the dream!

dismissalText.commentary: Fakhar Zaman lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: strikes second ball!. Given lbw but the batsman goes up to review. That looked out on first sight. Pitched on a length and spun in, carrom ball, beat his defensive prod to strike him on the pad. Bat and pad are very close to together, and there is a spike. I think it's of ball hitting pad, there's a gap between ball and bat. The third umpire's thinking the same. And ball tracking shows three reds! So not only have Pakistan lost Fakhar, they've lost a review too.

dismissalText.commentary: Imam-ul-Haq st †Ikram Alikhil b Mohammad Nabi 36 (51b 4x4 0x6 60m) SR: 70.58

dismissalComment.html: charged and stumped! What was Imam thinking? Charges seemingly out of nowhere in impetuous fashion. Nabi darted this in quicker at 91 kph/57 mph, and much wider too. Imam essentially yorks himself on the dance down the pitch playing over the top with a wild drive. Ikram was pulled away from the stumps on the width but still had enough time to shuffle across and dislodge the bails.

dismissalText.commentary: Haris Sohail lbw b Rashid Khan 27 (57b 2x4 0x6 58m) SR: 47.36

dismissalComment.html: Rashid's wicket drought is over! Beaten going onto the back foot and given leg before! Good length ball, touch more air, goes back to defend and misses, struck on the knee roll well inside the crease. Only real question for Paul Wilson was did this pitch in line with leg stump. He says yes. Haris is on his way!

dismissalText.commentary: Sarfaraz Ahmed run out (Najibullah Zadran/†Ikram Alikhil) 18 (22b 1x4 0x6 37m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: runout! Pakistan are throwing this away! Googly lands way too short and wide on around 7th stump. Sarfaraz cut this behind point for a simple one, the point sweeper Najibullah is the quickest fielder of the XI for Afghanistan and the last guy Sarfaraz should be taking on. He circles around like a Blue Tiger to pounce, fire a sharp relay to Ikram with Sarfaraz five yards short. Never a second run there. Imad wasn't really interested and Sarfaraz only has himself to blame.

seriesStandings.notes:
League Stage
In the event of teams finishing on equal points
* The team with the most wins in the League Stage will be placed in the higher position.
* If there are teams with equal points and equal wins in the League Stage then in such case the teams will be ordered according to their net run rate in the League Stage matches.
* If there are teams that are still equal, they will be ordered according to the result(s) of the head to head match(es) played between them (points, then if still equal, net run rate in those matches).
* If the above does not resolve the League Stage ordering and there are teams that are still equal, the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings.
* If all matches in the League Stage produce no results the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings and the top 4 seeded teams will progress to Semi-Finals.
Semi Final
If a Semi-Final is tied, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team progresses to the Final.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, then the team which proceeds to the Final will be the team that finished in the higher position in the League Stage.
Final
In the event of a tied final, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team is the winner.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, the teams shall be declared joint winners.
